sentences.text: We're going to start off this module by learning all the ways of moving to the front of the chord.
The lessons are going to be split up into the forehand and backhand side, and by the end of it, you should be comfortable with all of them.
What's interesting is that even though the forehand and backhand sides are different, the three movement options generally tend to parallel each other.
When we have a long distance to cover, we use running steps.
When we have a short distance, we use chassis steps.
And when the shuttle is high enough to kill, we use the net jump.
Of course, there's much more to it than that, and that's what we're going to cover in the next few lessons.
But I just wanted to give you a brief overview to see what we're going to learn.
Can you now understand why there's so much conflicting information?
Even though these are just two corners of the court, that's a total of six different ways of moving to them.
In fact, there are also many variations among the six options I just showed you.
I'm going to teach you everything you need to know, which will put you so far ahead of the competition.
Let's start off on the forehand side.
